Journal.Title: Environmental science and pollution research international

Article.ArticleTitle: Independent and interactive effects of ozone and thermal inversion exposure on the risk of gestational diabetes mellitus in Wuhan, China.

AbstractText: The adverse effects of exposure to thermal inversion (TI) and ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) on human health have been reported; however, there are few studies have explored the independent and potential interactive effects of them on gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM). A total of 31,262 pregnant women from the Wuhan Children's Hospital covering the period from 2017 to 2021 were included in this study. The logistic regression adjusted for the covariates was applied to explore the independent effect of exposure to O<sub>3</sub> and TI on GDM. The relative excess risk due to the interaction (RERI) analysis was applied to assess the possible interactive effect. Per 10 μg/m<sup>3</sup> increased in O<sub>3</sub> (OR = 1.069, 95% CI: 1.049, 1.089) during the first trimester and per 10 days increased in TI (OR = 1.041, 95% CI: 1.005, 1.080) in the second trimester were significantly associated with the risk of GDM. The synergistic effect of exposure to TI and O<sub>3</sub> was larger than their sum effect (RERI = 0.330, 95% CI: 0.170, 0.476). This study added further support for public health-related policy to improve maternal health by curbing TI and O<sub>3</sub>.
